snippet: Qingdao, one of China’s biggest seaside destinations, has been hit with a near-record algae bloom, leaving its popular beaches covered in a green, sticky muck.
abstract: Chinese coastal city Qingdao, one of country's biggest seaside destinations, is hit with near-record algae bloom, leaving its popular beaches covered in green, sticky muck; algae is generally harmless to humans, but not marine life.
lead_paragraph: Qingdao, one of China’s biggest seaside destinations, has been hit with a near-record algae bloom, leaving its popular beaches covered in a green, sticky muck.

headline.main: With Surf Like Turf, Huge Algae Bloom Befouls China Coast
headline.print_headline: With Surf Like Turf, Huge Algae Bloom Befouls China Coast
